Help Us Inspire the Next Generation of Environmentalists! Volunteer Our volunteers are a huge part of what makes Calusa Nature Center & Planetarium a success. You can¬† earn volunteer or service-learning hours in a number of areas such as: gardening, landscaping, maintenance, office work, animal care, education and more! Fill out an application via the Volunteer Application on the dropdown menu. If you have any questions, please email volunteer@calusanature.org Donate As a 501c3 not-for-profit organization, we receive all our funding from admission and donations. Every dollar we receive is put back into the care of our animals and the upkeep of our 105 acres. If you would prefer to donate items to help us with our everyday functions, we are always in need of new and used items such as: sheets and towels, hand and dish soap, hand sanitizer, sunscreen and bug spray, dog toys, produce, peanut butter, cleaning supplies, gardening tools, and office supplies! Visit here for a current list of urgent needs. If you have any other items you wish to donate, please give us a call to see if we can put them to good use: 239.275.3435 ‚Äã Internships We offer a wide variety of professional internships at the high school, undergraduate, and graduate school levels. We work directly with each individual student to develop an internship plan to focus on the goals and responsibilities of the student to maximize the real-world experience provided. Internships we have available but are not limited to: Environmental Education Research Wildlife/Zoology Non-profit Management Marketing and Public Relations Astronomy and Astronomy Education Event Planning and Fundraising Hospitality and Tourism For an internship application, or, if you do not see an internship opportunity on the list but have an idea and concept of what you would like to accomplish during your professional experience, please email admin@calusanature.org . All Posts Planetarium Search Summer Camp Registration Now Open ‚Äì Sign Up Today! eraddatz7 Mar 5 7 min read Registration is now officially open for our highly anticipated Summer Camp program! With a variety of fun-filled, educational, and adventurous camps, there‚Äôs something for every child this summer. From exciting outdoor exploration to hands-on activities and live animal encounters, our summer camps offer an unforgettable experience. Each camp is designed with a 20-child maximum and will be led by two experienced lead counselors, supported by full-time staff and interns. Our camps are tailored to specific age groups, and we adhere strictly to our grade-level guidelines to ensure the best experience for every child. Registration is now open for our Summer Camp program, offering a variety of fun, educational, and adventurous camps for children. With a 20-child maximum per camp and experienced counselors, kids will explore the outdoors, engage in hands-on activities, and enjoy live animal encounters. Camp Details: Cost: $200 per week for members $250 per week for non-members Special rate for the week of July 4th: $180 for members, $200 for non-members Camp Times: Drop-off: 8:30‚Äì9:00 AM Pick-up: 3:30‚Äì4:00 PM Camp activities: 9:00 AM‚Äì3:30 PM Activities Include: Indoor/outdoor exploration, hands-on crafts, games, hikes, planetarium shows, and live animal encounters. What to Bring: Change of clothes Towel Water shoes Refillable water bottle Sunscreen & insect repellent Packed lunch & extra snacks Available Camps by Week and Grade Level: June 9th Wild Florida (1st-3rd grade) Junior Naturalist (4th-6th grade) June 16th Outdoor Survival (1st-4th grade) Outdoor Survival (5th-8th grade) June 23rd Nocturnal Nature (1st-3rd grade) Riveting Reptiles (4th-6th grade) June 30th Feathered Friends (1st-5th grade) July 7th Space Science (4th-6th grade) Space Adventures (1st-3rd grade) July 14th Nature Crime Scene Investigators (4th-6th grade) Nature Detectives (1st-3rd grade) July 21st Outdoor Survival (5th-8th grade) Outdoor Survival (1st-4th grade) July 28th Nature Maker Space (4th-6th grade) Nature Maker Space (1st-3rd grade) August 4th Wild About Water (1st-4th grade) Camp registration will remain open until camps fill or until the Friday before the camp week begins. Don‚Äôt miss out ‚Äì sign up early to secure a spot for your child! For more information or to register, please visit https://www.calusanature.org/calusa-summer-camps and buy your tickets now ! Make this summer one to remember with unforgettable experiences, lifelong friendships, and the wonders of nature! ALSO COMING UP: Night Hikes March 28, April 25, May 30 (Times Vary) Join us for an immersive night hike through our preserve, where you can listen for owls, search the sky for bats, and discover constellations. Learn how animals adapt to the darkness, all while exploring the nighttime world. Get your tickets now! Nature Speaker Series ‚Äì Dr. Bill Hammond March 12, 2025 | 7:00 PM Dr. Bill Hammond, a passionate advocate for environmental conservation, emphasizes that nurturing nature is not only vital for preserving biodiversity but also essential for our well-being. By fostering a deeper connection to the natural world, we can develop a greater sense of responsibility to protect and sustain the environment for future generations. Dr. Hammond believes that spending time in nature has profound benefits for mental health, offering a sense of peace and renewal that is often lost in our fast-paced, technology-driven lives. He advocates for educational initiatives that encourage individuals to appreciate the intricate relationships within ecosystems and the essential role we all play in maintaining ecological balance. Nurturing nature, according to Dr. Hammond, is a responsibility that binds us together as stewards of the Earth, ensuring a healthier planet for all living beings. Get your tickets now! Come for a free taping of Gulf Coast Life at Calusa Nature Center March 22 at 10 a.m. Gulf Coast Life Broadcast on WGCU at Calusa Nature Center & Planetarium! March 22, 2025 | 10:00 AM Gulf Coast Life to Feature Calusa Nature Center & Planetarium on March 22nd We‚Äôre excited to announce that Gulf Coast Life , airing on WGCU, will be featuring Calusa Nature Center & Planetarium on March 22nd at 10 a.m. ! Join us for this exciting segment as Gulf Coast Life highlights the beauty and educational experiences that Calusa has to offer. The segment will feature fascinating nature talks, interviews with special guests, and showcase the vibrant atmosphere of our 105-acre sanctuary. It‚Äôs a fantastic opportunity to learn more about the incredible work being done at Calusa while surrounded by the wonders of nature. Gulf Coast Life is a locally produced talk show that strives to connect listeners to the people, places, and things that make Southwest Florida unique. The show is produced and hosted by Mike Kiniry , with contributing hosts John Davis , Cary Barbor , and Tara Calligan . The event is free and open to the public on a first-come, first-served basis , so be sure to arrive early to enjoy this exciting experience. If you'd like to explore the museum and planetarium for the rest of the day, the prices are: $13 for adults $7 for children Free for members For more information on memberships and to learn more about our museum and planetarium, please visit www.calusanature.org . Wizarding World Adventure March 22, 2025 | 1:00 PM ‚Äì 6:00 PM Wizards, witches, and muggles alike are invited to experience the magic at Calusa Nature Center & Planetarium . Enjoy a magic trail , create a potion in the potions lab , sip on a butterbeer , and participate in a costume contest . There will be spell demonstrations , magical crafts, and more! Stay tuned for official event details and ticket information! Get your tickets now! Paint and Sip: Ocean Breeze & Evening Storm ‚Äì Bob Ross-Inspired Painting Workshops in Fort Myers Join us for two exciting Paint and Sip workshops in Fort Myers on Sunday, April 6th, 2025 ! These beginner-friendly, certified Bob Ross oil-painting sessions are led by Mathew Halstead C.R.I. from Lazy Painter Brushworks . Whether you're a beginner or experienced artist, these fun and creative workshops are the perfect opportunity to create a stunning masterpiece. Ocean Breeze Workshop (10:00 AM ‚Äì 12:00 PM): Dive into the beauty of the "Ocean Breeze" painting and take home your own 12x16 masterpiece. Evening Storm Workshop (2:00 PM ‚Äì 4:00 PM): Create a breathtaking "Evening Storm" painting in this second session of the day. Both workshops include all painting supplies, and participants should wear clothes that can get messy. It‚Äôs essential to arrive on time as catching up during the session can be challenging. Ticket Information: Price per session: $100.00 (+$2.50 service fee) Ticket Sales End: April 5th, 8:00 PM Don't miss out on this chance to unleash your inner artist and enjoy a relaxing, step-by-step painting experience. Reserve your spot today and get ready for a fun-filled day of creativity! Get your tickets now! Earth Day Birthday Celebration April 19, 2025 | 10:00 AM ‚Äì 5:00 PM Celebrate Earth Day at CNCP with a full day of fun for all ages! Featuring guided hikes , live animal presentations , arts and crafts, and an array of local vendors , it‚Äôs the perfect family event to learn about environmental stewardship. Get your tickets now! Music Under the Stars May 1, 2025 | 7:00 PM Enjoy an evening of live music with Doug Sheminski opening for Andy Wahlberg at CNCP‚Äôs Music Under the Stars concert. It‚Äôs the perfect way to spend a night under the sky with great music and great company! Get your tickets now! Sponsorship Opportunities Available Sponsorship opportunities are available for all upcoming CNCP events! Your support helps us continue offering these educational programs and ensures that our preserve remains a place for future generations to explore and enjoy. As a sponsor, you‚Äôll receive recognition at our events and visibility among an engaged, community-minded audience. For more information, contact Eric Raddatz at eraddatz@calusanature.org or call 239-275-3435 . Nurture Nature Campaign: Help Us Preserve Our Sanctuary We‚Äôre excited with the success of our "Nurture Nature" Campaign in 2025, dedicated to improving CNCP‚Äôs facilities and educational programs. Your support will help us maintain essential infrastructure, repair boardwalks , preserve local wildlife , and expand our outreach efforts. This campaign is especially important as we work to create a deeper connection between local youth and the natural world‚Äîsomething that‚Äôs more vital than ever in an age where technology often pulls us away from nature. Become a nature nurturer today! Host Your Event at CNCP Did you know CNCP offers a unique venue for events? Whether you‚Äôre planning a wedding, meeting, or party, our indoor and outdoor spaces offer a beautiful natural setting for any occasion. Contact us to learn more about holding your event at CNCP. Learn more about rentals and book today! Mesmerica: A Visual Music Journey Every Weekend Mesmerica is a one-of-a-kind visual music experience , blending stunning 3D art with the soothing sounds of James Hood . It‚Äôs the perfect way to relax and experience a world of hypnotic imagery and sound. Get your tickets now! Become a Member Today When you become a CNCP member , you enjoy a host of exclusive benefits, including: Free admission to trails, planetarium shows, and live animal talks Discounts on camps, workshops, and select events 10% off at the gift shop Free or discounted admission to over 180 nature centers nationwide Join today and connect with nature all year long About Calusa Nature Center & Planetarium: Founded in 1969 , the Calusa Nature Center & Planetarium has served as Southwest Florida's premier environmental education destination for over 50 years. CNCP is a 501(c)(3) tax-exempt organization , and donations are tax-deductible to the fullest extent of the law. Sponsorship and partnership opportunities are also available for those interested in making a significant impact together with us. The 105-acre sanctuary houses butterfly gardens, bird aviaries, nature trails, and the only public planetarium in the region. CNCP provides educational experiences that promote environmental awareness, scientific discovery, and a lifelong love of nature, inspiring future generations of environmental stewards and advocates. ‚Ä¢ A Special Thank You: We extend our heartfelt thanks to Ace Hardware, the place with the helpful hardware folks, as well as continuing supporters, including Vulcan Materials, R4 Roofing , Aux Delicies , Famous Dave‚Äôs , The City of Fort Myers , HERC, SWFL PRODUCE, Sanibel Captiva Community Bank , The Fred and Jean Allegretti Foundation , Heitman House , Babcock Ranch and the Fort Myers Film Festival. ‚Ä¢ Stay Connected Cozy at home? Immerse yourself in our fresh interactive education videos here. Make your event unforgettable with one of Florida's unique venues! From weddings and showers to meetings and parties, we offer stunning indoor and outdoor spaces. Reach out now to reserve your date! Our mission, inspiring people to connect with nature, is accomplished by educating both children and adults about our unique ecosystem and environmental issues concerning our area. All Posts Planetarium Search Renowned Cartoonist Doug MacGregor to Headline Calusa Nature Center‚Äôs First-Ever Arts & Crafts Fair eraddatz7 Apr 10 6 min read FORT MYERS, FL (April 10, 2025) ‚Äî The Calusa Nature Center & Planetarium is proud to announce that one of Southwest Florida‚Äôs most beloved artists and storytellers, Doug MacGregor , will be the featured headliner at the Center‚Äôs Arts & Crafts Fair on May 10, 2025 , from 10:00 AM to 4:00 PM . With a career spanning over four decades, Doug MacGregor is a celebrated cartoonist, children‚Äôs book author, illustrator, musician, and advocate for arts in healthcare. His whimsical, imaginative art has brought smiles to generations of readers and viewers alike. Known for his long tenure as editorial cartoonist for The News-Press , MacGregor has also made a profound impact in hospitals, schools, and libraries across the region. At the Arts & Crafts Fair, Doug will lead special art sessions and demonstrations, showcasing the joyful power of creativity to connect us with both nature and each other. His original artwork and books will be available for purchase, and he will generously contribute an exclusive piece to the Calusa Nature Center‚Äôs permanent collection. ‚ÄúDoug‚Äôs creativity, compassion, and deep connection to the Southwest Florida community make him the perfect artist to headline this new celebration of nature and expression,‚Äù said Eric Raddatz , Executive Director of the Calusa Nature Center. ‚ÄúWe are beyond honored to host him for what will be an unforgettable day.‚Äù Also joining the festivities is acclaimed local painter Whitney Hackett , known for her dreamlike, nostalgia-infused works that celebrate everyday life through a playful and heartfelt lens. Hackett is the creative force behind Quartz and Clover and Curio , two artistic staples in downtown Fort Myers. The Arts & Crafts Fair will take place on the scenic grounds of the Calusa Nature Center‚Äîa 105-acre preserve home to nature trails, butterfly gardens, animal exhibits, and the region‚Äôs only public planetarium. The event will feature local artists and artisans whose work celebrates themes of nature, wildlife, and the cosmos , with offerings including handmade jewelry, sculpture, textiles, pottery, and more. Artist Vendor Information: Date: Saturday, May 10, 2025 Time: 10:00 AM ‚Äì 4:00 PM Location: Calusa Nature Center & Planetarium, 3450 Ortiz Ave, Fort Myers, FL Vendor Fee: $50 (Featured artists are exempt) Apply: Email volunteer@calusanature.org with samples and a short artist bio Indoor and outdoor spaces available Featured artist spots and vendor spaces are limited. Interested artists are encouraged to apply early to be part of this one-of-a-kind opportunity to showcase their work in a vibrant, nature-filled setting. He has published six children‚Äôs books, volunteers at Golisano Children‚Äôs Hospital, and performs with his 60s/70s rock band, The Rosada Project . All Posts Planetarium Search Celebrate a Bright 2025: Join Us in the Joy of Protecting Nature and Enjoy Our Holiday Lights One More Weekend! eraddatz7 Dec 27, 2024 5 min read Calusa Nature Center and Planetarium: Celebrating Milestones and Building a Sustainable Future for 2025 Fort Myers, FL ‚Äì December 27, 2024 ‚Äì As the year draws to a close, the Calusa Nature Center & Planetarium reflects on an impactful 2024 and looks ahead to exciting opportunities in 2025. This year has been a testament to the power of community support, environmental education, and innovative programming. With your help, we aim to continue nurturing nature and inspiring the next generation of environmental stewards. See what it is like to tour the 105 acres of unspoiled Calusa Nature Center & Planetarium with this cool video. Year-End Appeal: Nurture Nature Together Long-time SWFL leader and CNCP Executive Director Eric Raddatz emphasizes the importance of year-end giving to sustain the center‚Äôs vital mission: "The mission is tied to my personal mission‚Äîto nurture nature, to preserve our surrounding and all that nature offers, including our unspoiled Florida, its wildlife, birds, and future generations," said Eric Raddatz. Your donation ensures we can offer hands-on learning, preserve local wildlife, and expand community outreach. Contributions help support the planetarium, the only one within a 90-mile radius, offering unique educational experiences. Donate Now : calusanature.org/donate Get your membership to the Calusa Nature Center & Planetarium Membership and Admission Rate Updates In response to rising operational costs, the center will adjust membership and daily admission rates starting January 15, 2025. New Membership Rates: Student Membership: $20/year Individual Membership: $50/year Family & Friends Membership: $90/year Grandparent & Extended Family Membership: $105/year New Admission Rates: Children: $7 Adults: $13 Lock in current membership rates by purchasing or renewing before January 15, 2025. Members enjoy year-round access to exhibits, planetarium shows, and discounts. Learn more at www.calusanature.org/plans-pricing Holiday LIghts continues for one more weekend! Don't miss the campfire and cocoa at the end of the trail! Holiday Lights 2024: A Festive Success The VIP Opening Night Gala started this year‚Äôs Holiday Lights event in style. The weeks following have seen our community enjoy exclusive access to the illuminated trail, a meet-and-greet with Santa, and festive treats. Holiday Lights continues one more weekend, this Friday, Saturday, and Sunday from 6 to 9 PM. Tickets: Adults (12 & up): $10 Children (3-11): $5 Members: Free (Membership ID required) Proceeds benefit wildlife conservation, educational programs, and environmental preservation. Purchase tickets at calusanature.org . Fischer Family Foundation: Supporting Summer Camp Scholarships The Fischer Family Foundation awarded $6,000 to Calusa Nature Center and Planetarium to provide scholarships for nature-based summer camps. These scholarships empower children from disadvantaged backgrounds to explore the outdoors and develop a lifelong appreciation for the environment. ‚ÄúThe organizations we support embody resilience, community, and transformation,‚Äù said Scott Fischer, founder of the Fischer Family Foundation. For more information, visit SFE-US.com/Fischer-Family-Foundation . 17th Annual BUG Chase 5K Run Mark your calendar for the Fort Myers Metro-McGregor Kiwanis BUG Chase 5K Run on January 25, 2025, hosted at Calusa Nature Center and Planetarium. This event supports the "Bring Up Grades" (BUG) program, encouraging academic improvement in local elementary students. Event Details: Location: 3450 Ortiz Avenue, Fort Myers, FL Time: 8:30 AM (Race day registration begins at 7:30 AM) Registration: $25 (pre-registration by December 6), $30 (December 7-January 24), $35 (race day); Youth discounts available. Proceeds benefit the BUG program and other youth initiatives. Register at MetroMcGregorKiwanis.com . Sponsorships start at $100. Contact Rachel Toomey at Rachel.Toomey33@gmail.com for details. Planetarium Director Heather Preston is honored by Executive Director Eric Raddatz as she moves to emeritus status, handing the reins over to Planetarium Manager Todd Sherman. Planetarium Leadership: Honoring Heather Preston The Planetarium at the Calusa Nature Center has created a new star. After a decade of extraordinary service, long-time Planetarium Director Heather Preston has transitioned to the role of Planetarium Director Emeritus. Under her guidance, the planetarium became a beacon of education and inspiration, delighting countless visitors with the wonders of the cosmos. Heather's dedication and vision elevated the planetarium‚Äôs programming and outreach, ensuring its place as a cherished community resource. As Heather steps back to a part-time role, Todd Sherman will assume the position of Planetarium Manager. Todd, who began his journey at the Nature Center by leading planetarium operations during Heather‚Äôs sabbatical in the Pacific Northwest, brings a wealth of knowledge and enthusiasm to this new chapter. Heather‚Äôs legacy will continue to shine as she supports Todd and the planetarium team. Mesmerica Visitors can enjoy the newly refurbished planetarium, the only one within a 90-mile radius, playing shows every day and select nights, including the visually immersive and hypnotic Mesmerica . This special show combines the mesmerizing music of Grammy-nominated composer James Hood with stunning 3D animated art from artists around the world. Designed to transcend time and engage your senses, Mesmerica is an unforgettable journey of sound and light. ‚ÄúI want Mesmerica to inspire you into taking a journey with me inside the mind, to engage your senses and feelings with a miraculous alchemy of sound and light!‚Äù said James Hood, show creator. What the Visitors are Saying Recent visitors have shared their excitement about the transformation of the Calusa Nature Center and Planetarium. One patron exclaimed, 'This place must be under new ownership!' while another added, 'This place seems way cooler than I remember!' These reviews highlight the center's refreshed atmosphere, with many noting a renewed positive energy and engaging programming benefitting our community. About Calusa Nature Center & Planetarium Founded in 1969, Calusa Nature Center & Planetarium has been a leading environmental education destination in Southwest Florida. Our 105-acre sanctuary features butterfly gardens, bird aviaries, nature trails, and the only public planetarium in the region. We are dedicated to fostering a love of nature and environmental stewardship through engaging exhibits, educational programs, and community outreach. Become part of our mission to nurture nature and inspire future generations. Together, we can ensure that Calusa Nature Center & Planetarium remains a place of discovery, connection, and wonder for years to come. ‚Ä¢ A Special Thank You: We extend our heartfelt thanks to our new sponsor Ace Hardware, the place with the helpful hardware folks, as well as continuing supporters, including Vulcan Materials, R4 Roofing , Aux Delicies , Famous Dave‚Äôs , The City of Fort Myers , HERC, Sanibel Captiva Community Bank , The Fred and Jean Allegretti Foundation , Heitman House , and the Fort Myers Film Festival. ‚Ä¢ Stay Connected Cozy at home? Calusa Nature Center: Renovated planetarium showing Taylor Swift, more News Cape Coral Sports Opinion Restaurants Advertise Obituaries eNewspaper Legals LOCAL Southwest Florida's only planetarium gets upgrade, plans Taylor Swift laser shows, more Charles Runnells Fort Myers News-Press Southwest Florida's only planetarium was long overdue for an overhaul. The roof, the seats, the floor ‚Äî they'd all been there since the planetarium opened way back in 1986, says Heather Preston, planetarium director at the Calusa Nature Center & Planetarium . And it showed. The roof leaked. The chairs were uncomfortable. And everything just looked ‚Ä¶ old. Not anymore, though. The Fort Myers planetarium just finished a major upgrade that includes new floors and carpeting, a new roof and comfy seats that now ‚Äî for the first time ‚Äî recline and have head support. "The new planetarium is going to be great," says Calusa Nature Center's executive director, Eric Raddatz. "It's going to feel like 2024 in there, and not 1985." The upgrade goes hand-in-hand with the last major change at the planetarium in 2020 : A 5.1 surround-sound system and high-end, Digitarium Lambda Plus laser-projection system. The planetarium reopened Wednesday after being closed about a month for renovations. A grand reopening takes place Friday, Sept. 27, including a free open house and limited screenings of planetarium shows. There will also be a VIP reception and movie screening that night. Tickets for the VIP event are $150. Raddatz says he can't wait for people to see the new place ‚Äî the only public planetarium anywhere near Southwest Florida. "From Bradenton to Miami," he says, "we're the only planetarium in a 180-mile radius." More renovations needed at Calusa Nature Center & Planetarium The planetarium upgrade is costing "at least a couple hundred thousands" dollars, Raddatz says. They're in the middle of a capital campaign to raise about $100,000 for the roof, alone, he says, and they're about halfway toward that goal. "We're still working on it," he says. They're also trying to raise money for other, much-needed renovations at the 51-year-old Calusa Nature Center. That work includes: Repairs and new lights for the parking lot, A new roof for the nature center, A new sign out front, And repairs for the center's air-conditioning system. Then there's the center's boardwalk, which has been closed since being damaged by Hurricanes Irma and Ian. "That's probably going to be a million, just to fix that," Raddatz says. Together, all these repairs, he says, will end up costing "millions of dollars." That's why they're looking for partnerships and sponsorships to pay for everything, including $10 million for the renaming of the center and $1 million for the renaming of the planetarium. "There's a lot we can do," Raddatz says. "We have a lot of projects." Mesmerica 360, Taylor Swift and more expected to be big draw at new planetarium Until then, Raddatz and Preston hope the renovated planetarium attracts more people to Calusa Nature Center to see its various shows and attractions. That includes real-time and prerecorded views of the night sky projected onto the planetarium dome, all-new laser-light shows starting in November (including Taylor Swift and Pink Floyd) and the popular, psychedelic "Mesmerica 360" series. That last series combines music with dream-like, 360-degree visuals that put people in a calm, peaceful mood, Preston says. "It's like a guided meditation," Preston says. "This is intended to be a healing experience." The "Mesmerica" shows have been a big hit at the planetarium, Raddatz says. ¬†"We sell out every weekend." On top of that, the planetarium plans to bring more concerts and theatrical plays to its upgraded planetarium stage, starting with the "Music Under the Stars" concert Oct. 17. That show features local singer-songwriters Brian Smalley, Bill Metts, and Roy Schneider from the Americana Community Music Association . With all the new upgrades at the planetarium, people will be able to watch those shows with better visibility and more leg room in the approximately 80 seats (down from about 87). "It should be a¬† good experience," Preston says. To learn more about the planetarium and get tickets to upcoming shows, visit calusanature.org . CNCP Reopens Saturday! eraddatz7 Oct 10, 2024 4 min read Fort Myers, FL ‚Äì We are excited to announce that Milton is gone and we are back in action starting this Saturday! After the recent challenges, our nature center, planetarium, Haunted Walk, and Mesmerica experiences will still be closed tomorrow but will reopen this Saturday, inviting everyone to join us for a weekend of adventure and fun. We understand the impact of the hurricane has been tough, but it‚Äôs time to shake off the dust and get back outside, or inside at our planetarium if you are looking for some AC and a great show! Our dedicated team and our amazing creatures have made it through safely, and we‚Äôre fully powered up and ready to welcome you! Join us for our Haunted Walk starting this Saturday and discover the wonders waiting for you. We can't wait to see you all again! Starting October 12 , the darkness descends upon the Nature Center every Friday, Saturday, and Sunday in October, beginning at 7:30 PM . Are you brave enough to face the terrors that await? Do you know how creepy 105 acres of unspoiled Florida preserves can be at night in season? Creepier than a hurricane named Milton! Venture into our haunted trails, where the spirits of nature and ghoulish creatures come alive! This is not just a walk in the park‚Äîit's a heart-pounding adventure designed to send chills down your spine while supporting a noble cause. The Haunted Walk serves as a crucial fundraiser, ensuring our beloved animal residents receive the care they need for the upcoming year. Details of the Haunting: What: 51st Annual Haunted Walk Where: Calusa Nature Center, 3450 Ortiz Ave, Fort Myers, FL 33905 Tickets: $20 in advance, $25 at the door Haunted Walk Dates: Saturday, October 12 starting at 7:30 PM Sunday, October 13 starting at 7:30 PM Friday, October 18 starting at 7:30 PM Saturday, October 19 starting at 7:30 PM Sunday, October 20 starting at 7:30 PM Friday, October 25 starting at 7:30 PM Saturday, October 26 starting at 7:30 PM Sunday, October 27 starting at 7:30 PM Get your tickets at www.calusanature.org or at the door! We will delight you with fright! Feel the chill of the night air as you encounter ghostly guides, spine-tingling surprises, and the unknown lurking in the shadows. Secure your tickets now ‚Äîif you dare! Join us for a hauntingly good time, and remember, every scream helps feed and care for our animal residents. Get ready for an unforgettable night of thrills, frights, and laughter. Can you handle the fear? Sponsorship Member Login WGCU Member Login PBS Passport Login WGCU Member Login PBS Passport Login Environment Gulf Coast Life Stargazing and nurturing nature at the Calusa Nature Center & Planetarium By Mike Kiniry Published¬†April 9, 2025 at 9:38 AM EDT Listen ‚Ä¢ 28:46 Courtesy photo Mike Kiniry; Eric Raddatz, Executive Director of the Calusa Nature Center and Planetarium; and Kaitlin Danks, Secretary of the Executive Committee of the center‚Äôs Board of Trustees In the early 1960s members of a newly formed local chapter of the Junior Welfare League decided that Fort Myers needed a natural history museum and planetarium. They began raising money through haunted house fundraising events, and momentum began building to establish a site for environmental and science education. In 1972, the City of Fort Myers granted a 105-acre lease of city property on the corner of Colonial Boulevard and Ortiz Avenue. A 1,200 square foot church building called The Iona House was donated to the Center in the late 70s and was moved to the current site of the Calusa Nature Center and Planetarium . Over the decades, the nonprofit has introduced countless young people to the natural world, and the cosmos, through educational programs. But their offerings aren‚Äôt only for young people ‚Äî the Center has also provided astronomy programs and laser light shows. These days its 105-acre site features a natural history museum with live native and teaching animals, a butterfly garden and raptor aviary, as well as exhibits about the animals, plants, and environment of Southwest Florida. And they host events like music under the stars, paint and sips, night hikes, summer camps, and even an event called Potter in the Park . We sat down in their planetarium on a Saturday morning to shine some light on the work they do and the resources they provide to the community. Guests: Eric Raddatz, Executive Director of the Calusa Nature Center and Planetarium Kaitlin Danks, Secretary of the Executive Committee of the center‚Äôs Board of Trustees WGCU is your trusted source for news and information in Southwest Florida.
